content.question: Which of the following is the solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, y squared, minus, open parenthesis, x y, close parenthesis, squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="y of 3, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, five sixths, minus, the fraction with numerator 3, and denominator 3 x, minus, x cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator negative 3, and denominator 3 x, minus x cubed, plus 15, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, 3 x, minus x cubed, plus 19, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, e raised to the x minus, one third times x cubed, plus 6, power, close parenthesis, raised to the one half power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator negative 3, and denominator 3 x, minus x cubed, plus 15, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
